main.paragraph1.1: This Website is a practical example of implementing a Language Switcher (Locale) system based on Cookies within the Next.js framework.
main.header2: Which technologies were used to develop this Website?
main.paragraph3.1: As soon as you enter the Website, a Cookie with the key 'lang' is set in your browser. This Cookie is responsible for defining which language the Website will be configured in.
main.paragraph3.2: The possible values for this Cookie are: (en, pt), which correspond to English and Portuguese respectively.
main.paragraph3.3: If the Cookie assumes an invalid value, the system will automatically set the Cookie value to the default Website language, which I defined as English.
main.header4: Why did I develop this Website?
main.paragraph4.1: Having the technology to change your Website language natively is extremely important nowadays. A Website that can adapt to the user conveys greater professionalism, care, and seriousness toward the client. Motivated by this, I started studying different techniques developers use to implement this feature in their systems. That is how I arrived at this conclusion: a system that manages the Website language through the user's browser cookies.
